page.title: 15NAVAL OFFICER'S INTERVIEWS.
page.content: The{A.I.B.}is situated at {H.M.S.Sultan,}Gosport, and is a{Royal {Naval}establishment.If they are chosen they learn how to become an officer.They must be fit,have five 'O' levels including Maths,English and Physics.The candidates have to be 17\ - 26 years old.'A'levels help but they are not necessary.They stay three days but they are allowed free time.They start at 6.15a.m. and finish at 5.30p.m.They do written and practical tests,interviews,discussions and pass a stiff medical.They can be from any part of the world as long as they have a{British Passport.}They can be coloured and if they are Indian and religious they are permitted to wear a turban.2,500 candidates are interviewed each year but the pass rate is low.It is the only Admiralty Interview Board in the British Isles.
